portfolio: From Fifty-three Stations by Two Brushes (Sōhitsu gojūsan tsugi 雙筆五十三次)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga} | 廣重画 {Hiroshige ga}
text: In addition to being a town along the To_kaido_ Roadway, Numazu was also the setting a famous scene in the Kabuki play, Igagoe. In this play, a traveler named Ju_bei is befriended by a local porter who invites the young man to his home. Through a series of mishaps, it is eventually revealed that the porter's daughter, Oyone, is actually Ju_bei's sister. In this print, Kunisada shows Oyone folding Ju_bei's jacket probably unaware, at this point, that they are siblings. Above, Hiroshige provides a scene of Numazu at the foot of Ashigara Mountain.
title: Numazu: The Ashigara Mountains and Numazu Station; Actor Bando Mitsugorō III as Jūbei, with Oyone
